use the available contextual and diagnostic information in developing a
comprehensive treatment plan that is informed by the individual’s cul-

and use of the most appropriate evidence-based treatment options for
each disorder are beyond the scope of this manual.
Although decades of scientific effort have gone into developing
the diagnostic criteria sets for the disorders included in Section II, it
is well recognized that this set of categorical diagnoses does not fully
describe the full range of mental disorders that individuals experi-
ence and present to clinicians on a daily basis throughout the world.
